message: I have a car if someone wants to take up a collection...
I'd be down for a driving trip to a bakery sometime today.
I bet there is good pie somewhere in this town.
I'm in: is there a bakery which delivers?
I would get a zipcar if there are no car volunteers
Sounds good to me. This evening, maybe 6ish?
i can def. get down with some pie.
@acdha: er, hi! I'm Asheesh; I recognize your nick from OpenHatch I think (-:
I dont know re: bakery that delivers. I think Will Kahn-Greene wants to go on an adventure, rather than just *have* pie.
(I'm carless, so this is an unfunded mandate until someone with a car also think it's a good idea)
@asheeshlaroia Yes - you guys are sprinting here, too? I'm hiding out in the corner of the Django space
I have a car, but there is a bakery across the street... dunno about their pie situ
I'm dinnering at 6:30 tho
so maybe not a good choic
e
I just realized that I was staying in the Pi room throughout the main conference :)
word on the street is that there is pie in the second food court down stairs. also checking out the corner bakery across the street is a viable option.
@ryazwinski I'm sure some late-night pie would go over well for midnight hacking :-)
Pi day is 3.14... not 3.15... just sayin :)
if we're going to do Pi-day pie we'd best do it soon are we'll loose people to dinner/drinking
http://www.cornerbakerycafe.com/MenuNutrition/Menu.aspx?category=1029 suggests that Corner Bakery does not have much in terms of pie. The second food court is a good bet.
late night pizza pie also may be appealing to some..not @jaaarel unfortunately but others perhaps!?
And some non-dairy pie would be awesome
I won't complain as long as the pie was purchased on 3.14
Totally appealing.  Just without the cheese! :)
Surely the 22nd of July is a better Pi Day what with 22/7 a far better approximation of Pi than 14/3 :)
well, i'm not a fan of π anyway, ħ is way cooler

I can't believe PYcon failed at Pi day - I was planning to make it happen, then others looked like they were taking up the charge so I stepped back.  Now I feel bad. :(  Should have gone with my instinct in the 1st place. *sigh*
(blame them)
Actually, this is the first time I heard about Pi Day
(so don't blame me)
I blame myself.  I was going to arrange it, but then stepped back because others seemed to be taking the lead.  Should have just done it anyhow.  *ashamed*
@ryazwinski @coderanger made a valient attempt at a last minute (11:47PM) save: http://t.co/VwCCRiK
@acdha Definitely deserves the 2011 Save Pi Day prize. Well done!
@ryazwinski No shame. PyCon seduces us away from our original intentions by mising us with other interesting people.
